metadata.title: CVE-2016-9132 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In Botan 1.8.0 through 1.11.33, when decoding BER data an integer overflowcould occur, which would cause an incorrect length field to be computed.Some API callers may use the returned (incorrect and attacker controlled)length field in a way which later causes memory corruption or otherfailure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbotan-1.10-1 - 1.10.14-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: botan1.10 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.14-1').
